data.message: For everyone commenting on his skin color... Let's ask the same question for black artist... You ask... "If Em was black would he be as big of an artist as he is now?!" My question is, if Young Thug or any black rapper was white would they even be taken seriously or have a career in music?! And I mean EVERYONE... PAC and BiG too, sure they'd have a career but the impact wouldn't be shit compared to what it is now... If they were white they would never be who they are now... Think before you play that card... Because if the roles were reversed he'd still be a dominant artist and even with half his fan base gone the other artist would never survive the criticism lol... I mean, I bet if Slim Jesus was black he'd be in everyone's iPods like some bullshit ass rappers are now... Complexity should have nothing to do with art... I know Young Thug and Gucci Mane would not be here if they were white... And if you sit here and disagree you need to be slapped into another dimension...

replies.message: du hast recht es gibt ja schlisslich auch viele schwarze ganz grosse Küntler.
I have no idea what you just said, not even gonna lie!!
The answer is yes. Yes they would, white people been taking genres and making them popular for years dude

Man, no... If Young Thug was doing everything he is now and rapping about what he was rapping about but was white he'd be getting so much hate... I mean just imagine Lil' Wayne being white... They would say they're wiggers and talk hella trash...
Like I said, we're only changing the complexity... The lyrics and everything are the same...
you think young thug is good?
No, I can't stand him... But obviously millions of people do... But I'm sure millions of opinions would change if he was white and they would look at him like Slim Jesus...
My point lol... I just came across this and already, if this was PAC... You're telling me he'd be who he is now?!
